title: Magnetic field - two long current-carrying wires

content.question: Two current carrying wires are placed next to each other, as shown. One wire has a current of <math alttext="2 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> directed toward the bottom of the page and the other has a current of <math alttext="3 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> directed toward the top of the page. Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is located directly in the middle of the two wires. What is the magnetic field at this point due to both wires?
